objects.name: Analytic 0264
objects.description: Adversary adds a new Outlook rule with modified or obfuscated PR_RULE_MSG_NAME and PR_RULE_MSG_PROVIDER attributes using MFCMapi or Ruler. Rule is triggered when email arrives, executing embedded or external code. Mailbox audit logs or Unified Audit Log shows automated rule-triggered action without user interaction.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: m365:unified
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Creation or modification of inbox rule outside of normal user behavior

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: m365:messagetrace
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Inbound email matches crafted rule trigger pattern tied to persistence logic

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Mailbox rule changes may not be captured unless advanced audit logging is enabled
Malicious rules may use spoofed or non-standard PR_RULE_MSG_PROVIDER values
Triggering emails may contain uncommon but benign-looking subjects
Target user account may be inactive or high-value (e.g., VIP, service account)
